availability.p: © Duke Databank of Documentary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License.

revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - The omega in Γούνθων is clearly visible. I see no reason to dot it. The app entry proposed by Cowey should read <:τ̣ῶν=PN R. Bagnall (from photo)|ed|<:τὸν|reg|τ̣ῶν:>:> <:Γούνθω̣ν=PN R. Bagnall (from photo)|ed|Γοῦνθον:>, as per conventions in the Bulletin of Online Emendations to Papyri.

Vote - AcceptText - lin6 τ̣ῶν Γούνθω̣ν => <:τ̣ῶν=PN R. Bagnall (autopsy)|ed|<:τὸν|reg|τ̣ῶν:>:> <:Γούνθω̣ν=PN R. Bagnall|ed|Γοῦνθον:> This is ensures that credit is given and the old readings are preserved, which is as it should be, I think. Please check.

I have corrected the text to reflect what I believe is the correct reading of the word Γούνθων and the interpretation of the passage as "the tribune of the Goths" in keeping with the article of Zuckerman cited in the HGV record, and already (without discussion or readings) in R. Rémondon's article in Chronique d'Egypte 47 (1972) 266 (translation only). This lecture of Rémondon was published after his death and without the apparatus he would presumably have provided p. 254, n. *).
Automatic insertion of lb tags into origs to match existing lb tags in the reg
Second automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
moved linebreak and missing characters into reg
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)

div.ab:
τῷ κυρίῳ μου θεοσεβεῖθεωσεβῆ Ἄπα ἸωάννῃἸωάνην Λεῦχις ΜαλάμουΜαλαμος.
ἡ χρηστότηςχρηστωτητα σου κατέλαβεν πάντας τοὺς μὴμὺ δυναμένους·
καὶ ἐμὲκαμὲ φθάσῃφθάσι ἡ ἐλεημοσύνηνἐλεημωσύνην σου, κύριε. μετὰ τὸντων Θεὸν
τὴν σὴν βοήθειανβοήθιαν προσδοκῶπροσδωκῶ, ἵνα ἀξιώσῃςἀξιώσις τὸντων τρι
βοῦνοντρι
βοῦνων τῶντὸντῶν ΓούνθωνΓοῦνθον καὶ ἄρῃ αὐτὰς ἀπὸ τῆς οἰκίας
μου, ἐπεὶἐπὶ χήρα γυνή εἰμι. κύριέ μου, διὰ τὸντων ΘεὸνΘεὼν ποίειπύει.
